roleset.name: bother, pester, trouble

example.name: active
example.text: Many analysts said they weren't surprised that [problems in many of Ryder's lines of business]-1 continued *trace*-1 to plague the company.

example.name: passive
example.text: The Avon, Conn., company's stock hit a high in 1983 after it unveiled its Adam home computer, but [the product]-1 was plagued *trace*-1 with glitches and the company's fortunes plunged.

example.name: different passive
example.text: Par, a generic-drug maker that *T*-2 has been plagued [*]by management problems, was already the subject of a federal criminal inquiry into the drug-approval process and a Food and Drug Administration investigation.

example.name: ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: Perhaps there is a greater need among modern people - plagued by stress , insomnia , anxiety , and inability to concentrate - to find a way to chill out .
example.arg: by stress , insomnia , anxiety , and inability to concentrate

roleset.note: PLAGUE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'plague' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No access to verbnet. No comparison. (from plague.01-v predicate notes)
